intro: Reineckea, commonly known as the African silver tree, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Proteaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its unique, silver-gray foliage and showy, yellow flowers. The plants typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often with a gnarled or twisted trunk. Reineckea species are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features such as thick, waxy leaves. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
